faqs.question: What is Legacy Decimation and how does it work?
faqs.answer:
[warning]Important: Since Blender 4.1, decimation has been removed from Cats due to performance issues. For Blender 4.1+ users, please use [link]https://github.com/feilen/tuxedo-blender-plugin|Tuxedo[/link] which offers superior decimation functionality.[/warning]

Cats offers several decimation options for older Blender versions:

[details]Save Decimation|Safely decimates only meshes without shape keys.[/details]

[details]Half Decimation|Decimates meshes with less than 4 shape keys (typically non-essential ones).[/details]

[details]Full Decimation|Decimates the entire model, removing all shape keys in the process.[/details]

[details]Custom Decimation|Allows manual selection of meshes and shape keys to preserve during decimation.[/details]

faqs.question: Common Decimation Issues and Solutions
faqs.answer:
[info]Here are the most common decimation issues and their solutions:[/info]

[details]Combined Meshes|Q: Why does decimation combine all meshes?
A: This is intended behavior. For individual object decimation, use Blender's built-in tools instead.[/details]

[details]Broken Shape Keys|Q: Why aren't my visemes/shape keys working properly?
A: Decimation can break shape keys. Use Blender's native tools:
- Enter Edit Mode
- Press X for the deletion menu
- Try options like dissolve edges/vertices or limited dissolve
- Alternatively, use Mesh > Clean Up > Decimate Geometry[/details]

[details]Poor Results|Q: My avatar looks bad after decimation
A: You likely over-decimated the model. Try:
1. Using a higher decimation ratio
2. Using Blender's native tools for more control
3. Using [link]https://github.com/feilen/tuxedo-blender-plugin|Tuxedo Plugin[/link] for smart decimation[/details]

[warning]Lost Shape Keys Warning|If you've lost shape keys after decimation, this is expected behavior. The tool clearly states it will remove shape keys. For shape key-preserving decimation:
1. Use Blender's built-in tools
2. Try the Tuxedo plugin
3. Use Custom Decimation with careful selection[/warning]

[note]Professional Recommendation: While Cats decimation is suitable for basic needs, learning Blender's native tools or using Tuxedo plugin is highly recommended for better results and more control.[/note]
